class.name: CameraFeed
class.brief_description: A camera feed gives you access to a physical camera attached to your device.
class.description: A camera feed gives you access to a physical camera attached to your device with specific media size and format. When enabled, Godot will start capturing frames from the camera which can then be user as texture in other nodes. See also [CameraServer]. [b]Note:[/b] Some media formats, like YUV or N12 produce two textures (one for the Y plane and one for the UV plane). These textures need be drawn using a suitable shader where the Y plane is provided as TEXTURE and the UV plane as NORMAL_TEXTURE. See the camera project in the examples folder.

method.name: get_id
method.description: Returns the unique ID for this feed.

method.name: get_position
method.description: Returns the position of camera on the device.

method.name: get_width
method.description: Returns the width of the captured camera frames.

method.name: get_height
method.description: Returns the height of the captured camera frames.
